Actions to Take When Reviewing Form FFP-3 to Determine Fugitive Felon Status
Use the table below to when reviewing
Form FFP-3
to determine fugitive felon status under end product (EP) 290.
If the offense code and/or description ...
Then …
is not listed in
M21-1, Part XIV, 8.1.e
clear the corresponding EP 290 and take no further action.
matches a code or description in
M21-1, Part XIV, 8.1.e
follow steps outlined in
M21-1, Part XIV, 8.2
.
not provided
use the table below to determine the next appropriate course of action.
If a …
Then …
Veterans Service Center (VSC) or Benefit Eligibility Support Team (BEST) is processing the case
notify Compensation Service of the finding by e-mail (
VAVBAWAS/CO/212
), and
take no further action until Compensation Service responds to the e-mail.
pension management center (PMC) is processing the case
notify OIG of the finding by e-mail (
OIG51FugitiveFelonHQ@va.gov
)
requesting clarification, and
including Pension and Fiduciary (P&F) Service (
VAVBAWAS/CO/P&F TNG QUAL OVRST
) in the carbon copy (Cc) line, and
take no further action on processing the
Form FFP-3
until clarification is received from OIG.
Important
:
Form FFP-3s
that contain an offense code or description other than those listed in
M21-1, Part XIV.8.1.e
are exempt from automated EP 290 establishment under most circumstances.  Claims processors
do not
need to establish an EP 290 to process these forms, as they require no action.
